title: Stabilize App.tsx routing with single BrowserRouter, single Routes tree, and NotFound fallback

requirements.summary: Refactor App.tsx into a minimal React Router entry that uses exactly one BrowserRouter and a single Routes block, with '/' rendering the existing LandingPage.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/App.tsx` uses `BrowserRouter` (single instance) and a single `Routes` block.
Navigating to `/` renders the existing landing page (`LandingPage`) with no copy/layout changes.
No other file is required to add additional router wrappers (i.e., router is not wrapped elsewhere).

file_operations.description: Replace the current TanStack Router setup with a minimal React Router entry: a single BrowserRouter wrapping a single Routes tree. Ensure the '/' route renders the existing LandingPage component without modifying LandingPage or its composed sections.

requirements.summary: Add a '*' NotFound fallback route in App.tsx that shows a centered calm card with exact strings and a button navigating back to '/'.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to an unknown route (e.g., `/does-not-exist`) renders the NotFound card instead of a blank screen.
The NotFound view is centered and visually calm (card with whitespace, rounded corners, subtle shadow).
The NotFound view displays exactly: `404`, `Halaman tidak ditemukan.`, and a `Kembali` button that routes to `/`.

file_operations.description: Add a React Router '*' fallback route that renders a centered, calm card UI containing the exact title '404', text 'Halaman tidak ditemukan.', and a 'Kembali' button that navigates to '/'. Use the shadcn-ui Card/Button components for consistent styling (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.) and use React Router navigation primitives that avoid hooks inside App.tsx (e.g., Link).

requirements.summary: Eliminate duplicate router providers/route trees/Routes blocks and any leftover dev-only routing code that could cause loops, repeated mounts, hangs, or blank screens.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/App.tsx` contains no nested/recursive router providers (e.g., a provider that renders itself through a route component).
Preview loads reliably without intermittent blank white pages or hangs attributable to routing setup.

file_operations.description: Remove the recursive router/provider pattern and any TanStack Router route-tree construction from App.tsx so there is no self-referential rendering, nested providers, or duplicate routing trees that can cause render loops or repeated mounts.

requirements.summary: Verify and fix App.tsx imports and route-component casing/paths so builds succeed on case-sensitive file systems and all routes resolve correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: Project builds without import-resolution errors on case-sensitive file systems.
All routes used in App.tsx resolve to the intended existing components.

file_operations.description: Verify all route component imports (LandingPage, client/partner/internal pages) use correct relative paths and correct filename casing; ensure React Router imports come from react-router-dom and all referenced route components exist and resolve correctly.

requirements.summary: Ensure App.tsx is side-effect free: no hooks, effects, timers, listeners, or async-dependent conditional initial rendering.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/App.tsx` contains no hooks or side-effectful logic (no effects, timers, global listeners).
Initial render always mounts a route component deterministically, without waiting on async state.

file_operations.description: Keep App.tsx as a pure render-only routing entry: no useEffect/useState hooks, no intervals/timeouts, no event listeners, and no async-gated conditional rendering before routes mount.
